p: We used the relationship between mean daily air (1.25 m) and soil temperatures (20 cm depth), derived from a 15-year time series (1999–2014) of data from Mylnefield weather station (56°27'25.04"N, 3°4'23.77"W), to convert projected seasonal air temperatures to future seasonal soil temperatures ( Fig 1). Although this empirical relationship may differ among potato production areas in GB, it provides a reasonable approximation for the purposes of a first climate change risk assessment for non-indigenous Pectobacterium and Dickeya species in GB ( Fig 2A).
